# LandComp

LandComp is a package for quantifying landscape diversity and structure at
multiple scales. Juh√°sz-Nagy's functions, i.e. compositional diversity and
associatum are used for these purposes.

## Installation

You can install the development version of LandComp using the following command:

``` r
install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("ladylavender/LandComp")
```

## Example

### Example for using regular square grid

Suggest we have data on some vegetation types along a landscape. Note, there are three requirements:

* the landscape data should be binary (0 or 1)
* the geometry of the landscape data should be a regular square or hexagonal grid
* the geometry of the landscape data should have projected coordinates (i.e. WGS84 is useless)

```{r square_data, echo = FALSE}
suppressPackageStartupMessages(library("sf"))
library(LandComp)
data("square_data")
plot(square_data)
str(square_data)
```

Two values of landscape diversity and structure can be calculated as e.g.

```{r square_example, echo=TRUE}
LandComp(x = square_data, aggregation_steps = 0:1)
```

### Example for using regular hexagonal grid

```{r hexagonal_data, echo = FALSE}
data("hexagonal_data")
plot(hexagonal_data)
str(hexagonal_data)
```

```{r hexagonal_example, echo=TRUE}
LandComp(x = hexagonal_data, aggregation_steps = 0:1)
```
